text: Nadja Obrist (born November 4, 1972) is a paralympic alpine skier from Austria. She competed for Austria in alpine skiing at the 1994 Winter Paralympics in Lillehammer and the 1998 Winter Paralympics in Nagano. She won five medals: three silver and two bronze. == Career == At the 1994 Winter Paralympics in Lillehammer, Norway, Obrist won three medals: two silver medals in the downhill LW6/8 and super-G LW6/8 events, and a bronze medal in the giant slalom LW6/8 event. She also finished fourth in the slalom LW6/8 event. At the 1998 Winter Paralympics in Nagano, Japan, Obrist won a silver medal in the slalom LW3,4,5/7,6/8 event and a bronze medal in the downhill LW3,4,6/8 event. She finished fourth in the giant slalom and sixth in the super-G LW3,4,5/7,6/8 event. == References == Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Paralympic alpine skiers for Austria Category:Austrian female alpine skiers Category:1994 Winter Paralympics Category:1998 Winter Paralympics Category:Paralympic silver medalists for Austria Category:Paralympic bronze medalists for Austria
title: Nadja Obrist
